intro: Fumaria parviflora var. sinaitica, commonly known as the Sinai dwarf cress, is a flowering plant native to the rocky regions of the Sinai Peninsula. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often prostrate. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as a ground cover in arid landscapes.
